mdRecord.dcterms:title: A geological map of the copper region embraced in the counties of Floyd, Carroll & Grayson, Va., and Ashe & Alleghany, N.C., 1859 / by Richard O Curry, A.M.M.D. of Tennessee
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Currey, Richard O. (Richard Owen) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map : col. ; 47 x 35 cm. on sheet 56 x 37 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Shows four vertical sections in addition to the main map: No. 1 through Floyd County -- No. 2 through Carroll County -- No. 3 through Grayson County -- Sections [5] showing the position of the fossil ore beds in the vicinity of Cumberland Gap. [original]
"Geological survery of Kentucky. Part V. Vol. IV. Second Series)." -- At lower right. [original]

The map originally appeared in Currey's "Geological visit to the Virginia copper region. Knoxville, Tenn. Printed by Beckett, Haws & Co." Cf. Swem, E.G., Maps relating to Virginia, no. 891, p. 136. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 1 is colored; Copy 2 is trimmed and not colored. Both are linen-backed. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Copper mines and mining--Virginia, Southwest--Maps
